contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Five ships of the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''''Decatur''''', in honor of Commodore [[Stephen Decatur]]. * The {{USS|Decatur|1839|6}}, was a [[sloop-of-war]] built in 1839 and in service from 1840 to 1859. * {{USS|Decatur|DD-5}}, was a [[Bainbridge class destroyer|''Bainbridge''-class destroyer]] which served mainly in or near the [[Philippines]] from 1902 to 1919. * {{USS|Decatur|DD-341}}, was a [[Clemson class destroyer|''Clemson''-class destroyer]] which served from 1922 to 1945. * {{USS|Decatur|DDG-31}}, was a [[Forrest Sherman class destroyer|"Forrest Sherman"-class destroyer]] in service from 1956 to 1983, later converted to become the first [[Self Defense Test Ship]]. * {{USS|Decatur|DDG-73}}, is an [[Arleigh Burke class destroyer]] commissioned in 1998 and currently in active service. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Decatur}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
